name: Recursion Inferno! v1.0
description:
Knight is very similar to Femme Fatale, but since you can have both, I say: why not? Knight, Femme Fatale and Atman, can all benefit greatly from Scavenge. Same Old Thing is basically there just for Scavenge.

I picked Deep Red simply but because it allows to use Knight way more efficiently, and the extra 3 MU will fully cover all the Cäissa. Since I picked Magnum Opus as the main economy engine, though, I added a couple Akamatsu to allow some flexibility.

There is no R&D attack because of the Woman in the Red Dress, which would work against it. Instead, I prefer to go for HQ, which is rather unusual and less expected out of Shapers. Raymond Flint goes along this line of thought, especially since it can provide extra access during the Corp's turn... and a couple HQ Interfaces might help. Naturally, it might get risky against Jinteki, but nobody forces you into using Raymond Flint against them, after all. Especially since the access is mandatory. Or I might just add some Net Damage protection in the next version if I notice it would help a lot.

name: Rielle's Headlock v1.3
description: Switched the economy balance to a quicker 3 Armitage Codebusting-2 Kati Jones; I will eventually get the same result, and the 3 Katies were just a need from back when I just had her and the Sure Gambles. Also, Femme Fatale added by removing a Crescentus: It's a better spent MU, because the Omni-Drived Cipher will leave me room to play my shenanigan anyway. Scavenge now is useful to remap my Femme, too, and it becomes a new target for SOT along with Tinkering and Levy AR Lab Access.

name: Searching for Chaos Theory - Chess board
description:
Get the knights out early to probe out the ice. If you smell swordsman try to get femme out, but really shes to test run in for a surprise access. Once you know the ice strengths, set your atman at, for instance, 0 and 1. With bishop you're covered for ice 0-3 if you position your bishops correctly. With femme out, you most likely don't need an atman at 0, so 1 and 2 is good also. Then you're free to move your knights to support the atman/bishop pair. SMC can fetch bishops where needed, with deep red out, you can instantly throw it on the ice, same with clone chip.

Using femme and knight as support, this should lock out most ice for 2 credits per subroutine, or better 1.

You can use the 3rd atman at str 6 to protect against archer. This could go tagme if you're rolling in the cash and don't need to play daily casts, and you've played plascetes. They're in the deck to allow you 1 break with knight clickless each turn after installing.

name: Recurse me
description:
Hello! One of my favorite deck Rielle Recursive

Frist this deck is based on the card who give cred to use icebreakers(8 cred -). With Rielle ability plus copycat the corp has to watch out of wich ice he places and in wich order. I know that dagger can be hard to play due to cloak but it's really powerful to break sentry and if you got some problem with sentry don't forget to use escher to reorganize the ice!! 1st always got Magnum Opus. Don't forget to run often as you can but watch out to run safe!

I add Notoriety because if the early turn you easily complete the 3 run and i'm sure you often lose a plenty of times because of 1 point... don't focus on installing all the cred provider card. Play it and you will se how to figure when your got to run once you got the cred card you can run for almost 0

As usual Play and Comments!!! I will answer any questions!

name: Scorthed Pie
description:
Here a Weyland tag and bad.

Try to score The Cleaners as soon as you can this card is very very valuable!! Thanks to it i dealed 13 Meat Dmg on my last tournament. Elizabeth Mills is here to remove the tag from Muckraker and can be use to trash some location. Dedicated response team is here to deal dommage because of the tag the runner can take with hunter, data raven or muckraker but don't forget to rez use if you're the target of Account Siphon it can dissuade the runner to use it or may deal 2 meat dmg or 3 thanks to the cleaners.

Try to begin with at least beanstalk or Hedge fund in hand, if you can keep a SE too it's very usefull. If you're under pressure and don't get enough ICE, play some remote as you can do in a Trap/Jinteki, Ghost branch gonna really bother the runner due to the fact it's tottaly free. It's help to make the runner paranoiac even if he can remove the tag with DRT and SE, he's gonnas doubt so you can score some agenda. Try to place a muckraker on the central server like R and D but don't forget to remove the bad pub with EM

Thanks for reading just Play and Comments, or Ask. :)

name: The Acelerated World
description:
Economy: Green Level Clearance, Hedge Fund an dShipment from Sansan and ice very cheap. Draw: Green Level Clearance, Anonymous Tip and Jackson Howard...it is important for search combo.

In the turn 2-3 is important make a remoto server for score agenda fast. This deck have a few agenda so...no it is necessary a good protect.

Power Shutdown and Swordsman will help to protect the server and continue with the fast advanced. Finally try make the combo for score 3-4 point of agenda.

Update [23/12/2013] + Interns: for search agenda in combo, is very util useful -2 draco: the trace is poor in this deck and i need credit for FA. +1 Pop-up Windows: Credit

name: Kates pretty red dress.
description: My next gen build of Kate. I'll be play testing and tweaking this concept over the next two weeks. Basic idea is to force corp to protect HQ and R&D more than they like. I used to have hostage and UWC but I tired of spending time drawing and playing them and I often wished hostage was an e shutdown instead. Magnum opus is fine for economy. Lots of draw, tutor, and search for what you need. Toolbox is fantastic, I'll click for credits and mod one and it's well worth it every game. Based on previous build, everything in this deck, sans WiRD, is now useful whenever I draw it.

name: Custom Biotics over advance
description: Get lots of cash, then midseasons after a steal. Psycho ares to blow up the rig, or vitruvious to use psycho over and over.
